commits.message: Revert "feat(ci): add GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline  - Add comprehensive CI/CD workflow with lint, test, build, and smoke test   jobs  - Configure ESLint and TypeScript type checking in CI  - Add test coverage measurement with Vitest  - Include Docker-based smoke testing for integration validation  - Add CI/CD status badges to README for build and test visibility  - Document CI/CD pipeline setup and job descriptions in docs/ci.md  The pipeline ensures code quality through automated checks on all PRs and   pushes to main branch, with planned branch protection rules to enforce  successful CI before merging.\n● I'"'"'ll exit the PatchAgent session.● Bash(exit 0)  ⎿  Waiting…  ⎿  Running…  Bash(exit 0)  ⎿  (No content)"

commits.message: feat(engine): add immediate processing support for zero timeout in runPty  Add support for silenceTimeoutMs=0 in the PTY runner to enable immediate  processing without timeout delays. This allows callers to bypass the  silence detection mechanism when real-time output is critical.  - Skip timeout setup when silenceTimeoutMs is 0  - Process data immediately without buffering delays  - Maintain backward compatibility for non-zero timeout values\n● I'"'"'ll exit the PatchAgent session.● Bash(exit 0)  ⎿  Waiting…  ⎿  Running…  Bash(exit 0)  ⎿  (No content)
commits.author: magi

rules.raw:
# Editor configuration, see http://editorconfig.org
root = true

[*]
charset = utf-8
indent_style = space
indent_size = 4
end_of_line = lf
insert_final_newline = false
trim_trailing_whitespace = true

[*.md]
max_line_length = off
trim_trailing_whitespace = false

# Local state and volume mapping
.custom_tools
.magi_output
.server
.chrome
.claude
.gemini
.cache

# Python bytecode
__pycache__/
*.py[cod]
*$py.class

# Virtual environments
venv/
env/
ENV/
.env.old

# Distribution/packaging
dist/
build/
eggs/
*.egg-info/

# Unit test / coverage reports
htmlcov/
.coverage
.coverage.*
coverage.xml
*.cover

# Jupyter Notebook
.ipynb_checkpoints

# VSCode
.vscode/
*.code-workspace

# Pycharm
.idea/

# macOS
.DS_Store
.AppleDouble
.LSOverride

# Windows
Thumbs.db
ehthumbs.db
Desktop.ini

# Logs
*.log

# Local development settings
*.env
*.env.local
local_settings.py
.aider*

# Node.js
node_modules/
npm-debug.log
yarn-debug.log
yarn-error.log

# Local state storage

# Ignore compiled files
*.js
*.js.map
*.jsx

# Allow specific JS files
!host/setup.js
!controller/webpack.config.js
!eslint.config.js
!templates/web-static/tailwind.config.js

/*chrome*

# Temporary split directories
temp-ecot/
temp-ensemble/

# AI-generated summaries and scratch files
summarie

# Ignore everything by default
*

# Only required directories
!controller/
!engine/
!setup/
!common/
!db/
!templates/
!ensemble/
!mech/

# Ignore unnecessary files in the included directories
**/__pycache__/
**/*.pyc
**/*.pyo
**/*.pyd
**/.Python
**/.env
**/.venv
**/env/
**/venv/
**/ENV/
**/Dockerfile
**/.server
**/.git
**/*.log
**/npm-debug.log
**/.dockerignore
**/.md

# Very important we don't overwrite the node_modules build for the container
**/node_modules

# Ignore dist directories - they should be built inside the container
**/dist
controller/dist
engine/dist

conventions.name: TypeScript: Strict mode
examples: // All strict type checks are enabled

conventions.name: Trailing whitespace
examples: No spaces at end of lines

todos.description: I need to analyze the provided files to identify technical debt, TODOs, security concerns, and performance issues. I will use the `read_file` tool to access the content of each file and then analyze them based on your criteria.

documentedNeeds:
Here's a summary of the findings for the development team:

**1. Overall Health Assessment:**

The project is in **good health**. We found only one minor item to address and no critical technical debt. This indicates a stable and well-maintained codebase.

**2. Most Urgent Items to Address:**

*   **TODOs found: 1** (Specifically, there is 1 high priority TODO).

**3. Patterns Observed:**

*   **Low Technical Debt:** The absence of critical technical debt is a strong positive pattern, suggesting good coding practices and proactive refactoring.
*   **Minimal Outstanding Tasks:** The single TODO indicates focused development and a good process for managing and resolving pending items.

**4. Recommendations for Improvement:**

*   **Address the High Priority TODO:** Prioritize the resolution of the single high priority TODO item to maintain momentum and prevent potential future issues.
*   **Continue Proactive Technical Debt Management:** While currently low, continue to actively identify and address any emerging technical debt during development sprints to sustain this positive trend.
*   **Maintain Code Review Rigor:** Continue strong code review practices to catch potential issues early and ensure adherence to coding standards.
